intro: Anotis kwangtungensis, commonly known as the Kwangtung anotis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 centimeters and features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, peppery scent when crushed. Anotis kwangtungensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
